intro: Stipularia mollis, commonly known as the silky stipple, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, fragrant, star-shaped flower that blooms in late summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil. Stipularia mollis prefers full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established.
